title: Next Gen Graphics Is Kinda Nuts..

comments.comment: We've come to a point that graphics are getting so close to looking real, that it's hard to make significant progress in them, because it takes orders of magnitude more processing power and development to do so.

"With great graphics comes great expensive computers". 
- Gamer Ben

"Wow the car looks a little bit more like car"
Perfect words that describe graphics improvements...
I agree with Felix though, the human animations are pretty off. But once we manage to perfect that, It's gonna almost impossible to tell.

It’s strange how they can make everything look so real except for the humans. I think it has more to do with the movement than the physical details of the face because they look like a photograph when they’re still, but we’re just so attuned to people, and people’s faces, that we can tell whenever something is slightly off with them.
10:39 while saying "the image that is perceived in our brain" he automatically points behind his head where the visual cortex is. The man knows what he speaks about
Looking at the trailer, and the games it’s like a back and forth. “It’s real”, “nope, it’s fake”. I keep on going back and forth between these two. Insane graphics

The main things that give it away still are the stiff mouth movements and the body language. People make little micromovements, which these avatars don't do. Additionally, digital avatars don't account for things like kinetic energy and gravity when moving around. When we do something like wave, jump, or start walking, our mass takes a moment to get moving from a resting state or when changing direction because it needs to overcome inertia. This should scale based on mass, for example, the acceleration curve should look a lot different for an avatar that starts running than an arm that starts waving. Currently, it breaks the illusion every time a digital human makes a movement that doesn't account for the laws of motion. It's such a subtle thing, but our eyes and brains are well adapted at picking these things out. Until animators and game engines can master inertia, and clean up those mouth movements, we're going to see right through it, though it is definitely getting better, at least until they start moving and running their mouths lol.
I love how when the Unreal 5 stuff started playing. Pewds became more quiet due to how impressive it looked XD
My biggest worry with super realistic graphic in games is how incredibly creepy models glitching will be...

The reason characters look less realistic than everything else is because human brains have evolved to recognise thousands of faces meaning we identify and recognise thousands of facial features and meticulous details to recognise a person. The technology to make a realistic animated talking face just isn't there yet.
Cant wait to be able to run something like this in 5 years when GPUs are available again.
It’s not really about it looking realistic it’s about feeling realistic. The physics, the environment and it not feeling uncanny.
I love how u played the intro once this time. Thanks Felix!

Its funny that the people probably do not look worse than the other parts in the videos but that our brains are just fully trained to capture every little detail in faces. I think that is a major reason why people dont look realistic in our eyes
Photorealistic graphics are without a doubt very impressive but for me, art style and art design will always be much more important.

Instructors in 3D modeling program: You don't have an infinite poly budget. Hero characters can be up to but no more than 20k polys.
Current devs: These rocks are over a billion triangles!
It's the lip movements in speech that almost always gives it away if it's CGI or real.
It seems like the graphics always mess up the way people smile and the way people walk, but other than that, IT LOOKS SO GOOD!

Something that they mostly don't think about and that will give a good detail to digital characters, is the tongue movement when the character talks. If they make the tongue move, touch the teeths and make some pauses while the character is trying to talk, like if the words where coming to their minds before they could say it, it would be much more realistic

Felix,"I want all games should look like this"
Potato pc user:
imagine a vr game in the world of the matrix. all HD environment, and the ability to do what they do. that is my dream for VR honestly
Tech demos for graphics have always been impressive for their time, but whether an actual game can make use of it is a different question.
I'm scared of the time when the developers have to add that artificial touch to the character design to distinguish it from reality.
Been seeing this for ages, we’re not gonna get it until we realise that the realism is NOT about the image, it is about THE MOTION.
Love how it started off like a normal video and then philosophical Felix just comes in for the last couple minutes talking about reality. We love Philosophical Felix

Felix: Wow that looks so good
Also Felix: Thats fake, easy, I can tell

Pewdiepie: I want all games to be like this.

Minecraft: nah, I'm outta here.

The problem is graphics usually impress for a very limited time, after which you get used to them and pure gameplay and everything else that makes up the game takes over. A bad game with good graphics is always worse than a good game with bad graphics.
I love it when Pewds gets into philosophy and gets really passionate about it.
I love how Pewds went to the extreme to give us the taste of his philosophical insights
5:23 the fact that he says it’s fake but that’s actually real is sending me

The issue with these animations is the perfection of their physics.

The gun recoil is almost directly up/down
The cars tumble like cylinders rolling

Reality is much more chaotic and it shows when watching simulated physics.
Dont think for a second I will ever ever ever forget what you did for me. Thank you man. Hope life is going well, Felix.
I like how he says there's no change in graphics then proceeds to saying "whoooo that's so cool!"

It's really really hard to have a human look good visually in these kinds of graphics mostly due to pores. Every person has their own unique pores which stretch and pull when they talk and move, and we as a species are evolved to pick up on the slightest movement and can instantly know what's real and what's not because of this.

"Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it,
doesn't go away."           Philip K. Dick
the ending broke my brain ngl

Nothing tells that "define real" move is genius (because the graphics there really make you question what was real and what not) more than Felix looking at one of 2 instances of real Keanu and genuinely saying "Fake!".

The thing about people & fabrics is that the fine detail of skin & the complexity of different fabrics all make it hard to emulate the way they absorb light/ reflect light. But this point, all were doing is making it easier for AI to create our own matrix. It's awesome how relevant the series will remain, even after the disastrous 4th one.

Imagine in a few years getting a fully in depth open world matrix game that looks like this where the goal is to break out of the matrix and when you do the game ends. (And you play as your own character, not like neo or trinity or anyone like that)
"Over a billion different triangles in each frame..." "...each one a specific color..." The ULTIMATE pixel art.
2055: anyone remember how they keep giving us realistic graphics when we had to turn down the graphics for a smooth gameplay

The reason we’re so much quicker to clock human animations and graphic even when they’re super high resolution is bc of a phenomenon called ‘the uncanny valley’. It basically states that we, as actual people, can instantly recognize when something isn’t ACTUALLY people no matter how realistic it may seem. A lot of the time, the highest resolution possible of an animated human can cause discomfort, because we can FEEL that it isn’t true

Imagine how insane all games that don't include humans will look?

Racing games, mech games, space games etc
let's agree, PewDiePie is just a Simulated character being tested by Google over the years and it's just fooling us and making us think it is real.
My man really looked at real Keanu and went “FAKE!”

I think what I love about seeing the matrix gameplay demo and seeing the buildings is that when you perceive it as real even for a split second I got flashbacks to cities I've been in and just the idea of what life is.... and memory....  and the fact that there are amazing humans out there than can create this incredible stuff. It's pretty beautiful.  Just hope some big corporation doesn't come along and f*ck it up like usual.... although that's inevitable sadly.
Whoever animated you did a great job.  Almost had me fooled.

I watched this video while high and I convinced myself I was living in a simulation and then convinced myself I was living in reality all in the span of a minute. How can this man make me think about this shit and laugh at the same time?? Goddamn I love Philosophical Felix

It’s weird… there’s always something off about digital humans when looking at their full body. I have never seen a full-body digital human that didn’t look off; I have no idea why. You can just tell

I think it’s mainly in facial expressions, hair, and movement. It’s always unnatural. Skin also always seems to be lacking detail in all of the scenes; at least, it seems like that to me. Anything that slightly deviates from real-world physics immediately throws it all off, because if it doesn’t naturally interact with the world they way it should it’s disconnected. That’s difficult to do with humans.
I remember when Uncharted came out I was blown away by the graphics then Uncharted 4 came out and that water never looked better

Unreal engine 5 is insane, especially with nanites effectively removing the polygon budget. And now with that plug and play human model software. I’ve been stoked about it since they first demoed it. 

Sure the AAA games will look top of the line, but I’m excited to see how this will take lots of low budget indie games from looking super cheap to at least looking like AA without much more legwork on the indie devs

"We shouldn't worry about whether we live in a simulation or not, but we should worry about if we are breaking down our reality"
- Felix Arvid Ulf Kjellberg 
Couldn't agree  more.
When they figure out how to make CGI humans look completely real it’s over for us

Fun fact: At 6:22, the Unreal team just took the original Warner Bros 3D asset of Neo and they just dumped the full model into their cutscene , which was a completely different environment with the old Neo metahuman model in it
What really blew me away is that first scene with neo waking up in front of the computer. I really though that was from the movie, learned afterwards its actually rendered.
He never disapoints to make us laugh btw he just reuploaded this vid as he added the sponser ad twice lol
This is actaully getting scary I could imagine a game having real-time characters and locations meaning they could make a game with all of us in it  real gta  or different scenarios.
I love this type of content and discussions. I hope you would do more discussing like this

Felix your philosophical insights about optical perception are refreshing! You’re a thoughtful human! Id like to see more of that side of you it’s intriguing
I agree with pewds at the end, I really found this creepy like they’re trying to make us live in a simulation and forget about reality… it’s starting as a game imagine 2060 this would be our reality
This makes me want a "mii" system where you can create a person with face scanning or something and use it in multiple future games

There's actually alot of videos online why it's insanely hard to create an animation where humans are almost real. Even with skin, so much detail has to go through that just to make it somewhat realistic.
5:20 "Fake". That part of Keanu is actually real... 5:51 is when it switches to CGI, up until the mirror which is real again (6:08 to 6:17). Then, all CGI from there on.
Honestly the “its just ten dollars” actually made me think more about it than other normal sponsors, i actually went to the description to see what it was

To me, it's still often pretty clear that it's fake, at least when it comes to the characters. It's not necessarily fake Keanu's hair that tipped me off, it's the slightly off facial muscle movements and the fact that his eyes look almost dead. And as soon as his eyebrows move in the other scenes, you can tell that the image quality of the skin immediately degrades.

Fun fact: at the preview that shows around 2:20. To get the rocks to look as real as possible, they have a team that goes on a search for rocks and takes 3D images of the rocks in different variations of light, which they then send back to the studio

The original Matrix actually didn't have the green tint. It premiered in normal colours. The green tint was later added in the blue ray version. There are actually 5+ different color variants of the movie. There is a cool video on it somewhere. I do agree that the green tint did make it iconic though and a shame they didn't add it in the new movie.
Pewdiepie’a philosophies are a rare gem but man do I treasure the absolute fuck out of them when they come around

I think it's interesting how fallible our memories are. Events can be remembered differently and unless it's recorded we don't know which version is the real one. So trippy to talk to your family about something you're so sure happened one way and then everyone remembers a slightly different version.
I sure hope whoever gets these graphics has a super computer
I love how the graphics look but I dont know if I want every game to look realistic because the games that are stylized always look better with a less realistic look :)
